replies.bodyText: DEADLINE_EXCEEDED makes more sense, I'll update as suggested.
replies.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: Why was this changed? 0 is default for number primitives so it's better to test a non-zero value like 1001
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
topic number in both the json string and TopicMessage object is changed to match the filter.
This test case and jsonError both didn't assert anything because there was no terminal operation followed by .verify(). Once terminal operation and .verify() is added, the test case will fail because the filter is for topic 0.0.0.
All other test cases use filter and topic messages for topic 0.0.0, so for consistency, I changed accordingly. So if we want to change it, should we change all other test cases as well?
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText: I see, good catch. I think we can just change json and jsonError as they are explicitly testing serialization/deserialization and we want to test non-default values.
replies.author: steven-sheehy
